definition: a misjudged legal case/a miscarriage (of justice)
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
unjust, fake and false charges (in a legal case)

sentences.english: On the contrary, the process of practice and misjudgments system for investigating abuses continued to arise.
sentences.chinese: 相反，在实践过程中，错案追究制的弊端却不断出现。

sentences.english: We found evidence that blew his case out of water.
sentences.chinese: 我们有证据表明他的案子是错案。

sentences.english: The third part unites the select cases to study origin of misjudged cases of death penalty.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分结合所选案例来探究死刑错案的成因。

sentences.english: Judicial independence includes independence of courts and independence of judges.
sentences.chinese: 现行的错案追究制影响了法官独立地行使审判权。

sentences.english: But why wrong Jiangshan City in a repeat?
sentences.chinese: 然而错案为何在江山市重演？

sentences.english: Higher mistaken rate and irregularities for favoritism are often produced.
sentences.chinese: 错案率高，徇私舞弊现象时有发生等。

definition: unjust, fake and false charges (in a legal case)
unjust charge or verdict/miscarriage of justice/frame-up
to bend the law in order to favor one's relatives or associates (idiom)
to conclude a case/to wind up
